channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15291] FileSystem not closed in secure bulkLoad
item.description: FileSystem not closed in secure bulkLoad after bulkLoad finish, it will cause memory used more and more if too many bulkLoad .
item.summary: FileSystem not closed in secure bulkLoad

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment: Please help to review
lgtm
What happens when there is a call to SecureBulkLoadEndpoint#cleanupBulkLoad after SecureBulkLoadEndpoint#secureBulkLoadHFiles, did you check ?

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Hi Ashish Singhi, thanks for you comment. I checked via in MiniHBaseCluster, it worked. And I just check it has been in UT code.
Thanks

Yong Zhang, my understanding is when we call


 fs = FileSystem.get(conf);

by default it will get the FS from cache and not create a new one as the default hadoop configuration fs.%s.impl.disable.cache value is false, so if we close the FS here and at later part of code if we access it then we may tend to get exceptions.
This fs inner ugi.doAs is created by ugi, it will not used others.
This may cause problems when complete bulk load is ran using same user as RS user.
Add user check for bulkload user and hbase user

Add new patch based on your comment.
thank you very much.
lgtm

-1 overall

hi Yong Zhang, this method is executed in ugi.doAs method, which means UserGroupInformation.getCurrentUser().equals(ugi) would always be true.

Haitao:
See if the addendum does what you intended.

Hi Ted Yu
the patch submitted by me has been verfied, it will remove the for the filesystem object for the user who initiates the bulkload

Haitao:
What you attached is equivalent to the addendum I attached.

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/access/SecureBulkLoadEndpoint.java

There is a race condition caused by this fix and it is risky.

For example, the same region server hosting two regions: region1 and region2.
Secure bulkload calls into both region1 and region2.
The calls are from the same UGI so they will share the same fs. If one region finishes earlier, it will close the bulk load fs, and the other region will fail.

Jerry He:
SecureBulkLoadManager needs to be modified to revert the change in master branch.

Mind doing the revert and attaching the diff ?

Thanks
Ted Yu, How about using "FileSystem.newInstance(conf)" instead of "FileSystem.get(conf)" and closing same in finally block?
